summary: Web experience with a playful moving “No” button and a hidden admin interface for updating BF/GF names and message.
architectural_notes: “No” button movement must be constrained to the visible browser/phone viewport and remain clickable; it should reposition up to 10 times.
Hidden admin interface must authenticate with fixed credentials: username "akash" and password "2026edit".
known_issues: Bug: After the first move, the “No” button can render outside the browser viewport, becoming unreachable/un-clickable.
Bug: Hidden admin interface login is not working with credentials akash / 2026edit, preventing updates to BF/GF names and message.

existing_features.title: Fix the evasive “No” button behavior in `frontend/index.html` so it always remains fully within the visible browser viewport (including after the first move), stays clickable, and continues to evade the cursor for up to 10 moves as intended.

Repair the hidden admin interface in `frontend/index.html` so logging in with username `akash` and password `2026edit` works, and the admin can update the BF name, GF name, and the main message as intended.

Update backend admin verification in `backend/main.mo` so admin-gated operations use the password `2026edit` (to match the required admin credentials) and ensure frontend admin checks that call `isAdmin(...)` succeed with `2026edit`.

projectName: Fix runaway “No” button bounds and repair hidden admin login (akash / 2026edit)
